fields.headline: This week's new films
fields.bodyText: Marley (15) (Kevin Macdonald, 2012, US/UK) 145 mins Authoritative to the point of exhausting, Macdonald's documentary compiles an awesome amount of footage, photos, interviews, etc – but then it's a big subject. Whether you really get to the man beyond the legend is debatable (this was made with Marley family backing), but there's much here you've never seen, from Bob's Rasta roots to his kick-around in London's Battersea Park. Salmon Fishing In The Yemen (12A) (Lasse Hallström, 2012, UK) Ewan McGregor, Emily Blunt. 106 mins An incongruous setting for a mushy fish-out-of-water romcom, with Blunt and her sheikh boss lured by McGregor's tackle. Elles (18) (Malgorzata Szumowska, 2011, Fra/Pol/Ger) Juliette Binoche, Anaïs Demoustier. 99 mins Empowerment and eroticism mix uneasily when Binoche's enquiries into student prostitution affect her own life. Irvine Welsh's Ecstasy (18) (Rob Heydon, 2011, Can) Adam Sinclair, Kristin Kreuk, Billy Boyd. 99 mins Rave-era yarn that's 15 years too late to be the Trainspotting of MDMA it wants to be. Lockout (15) (James Mather, Stephen St Leger, 2012, Fra) Guy Pearce, Maggie Grace. 95 mins Pearce must rescue the president's daughter from a maximum security prison … in space! Beauty (18) (Oliver Hermanus, 2011, SA/Fra/Ger) Deon Lotz, Charlie Keegan. 105 mins Tense, hard-hitting study of a South African whose desire for his daughter's boyfriend threatens his closeted existence. Fury (18) (David Weaver, 2012, US) Samuel L Jackson, Luke Kirby. 90 mins Tricksy Toronto noir with Jackson's ex-conman co-opted into a twisty scam. Breathing (15) (Karl Markovics, 2011, Aus) Thomas Schubert, Karin Lischka. 94 mins A young offender's job at an undertakers' sets him on the road to redemption. The Divide (18) (Xavier Gens, 2011, Ger/US/Can) Michael Biehn, Lauren German. 112 mins Survivors in a New York nuclear bunker descend into barbarism and torture porn. Town Of Runners (PG) (Jerry Rothwell, 2012, Eth/UK) 89 mins Refreshing documentary on the champion-spawning Ethiopian village. Elfie Hopkins (18) (Ryan Andrews, 2012, UK) Jaime Winstone. 89 mins Low-budget horror antics. Gone (15) (Heitor Dhalia, 2012, US) Amanda Seyfried, Jennifer Carpenter. 95 mins Silly mystery thriller. Hollywoo (15) (Frédéric Berthe, Pascal Serieis, 2011, Fra) Florence Foresti, Jamel Debbouze. 107 mins Franco-goes-to-Hollywood comedy. Transit (15) (Antonio Negret, 2012, US) Jim Caviezel, 88 mins Robbers pursue a family through the Louisiana wilds. Vicky Donor (NC) (Shoojit Sircar, 2012, Ind) Annu Kapoor. 150 mins Indian farce based around a fertility clinic. The Bad & The Beautiful (PG) (Vincente Minnelli, 1952, US) Lana Turner, Kirk Douglas. 118 mins Hollywood melodrama that's still close to the bone. Out from Friday Avengers Assemble The superhero gang's all here for a big finale. Out from Thu The Assault French airline hijack thriller based on real events. Out from Mon Damsels In Distress Whit Stillman casts a wry eye over preppy college life. Albert Nobbs Glenn Close masquerades as a 19th-century butler. The Monk Vincent Cassel plays a holy man who falls from grace. Being Elmo Uplifting documentary on Kevin Clash, the man behind the muppet. Buck The original horse whisperer gets his close-up. Outside Bet Mates in the 1980s stake everything on a racehorse. 388 Arletta Avenue Stalker's-eye twist on the home-invasion thriller. African Cats Including lions, cheetahs and Samuel L Jackson. Laugh At My Pain Stand-up Kevin Hart on his rise to fame. Strippers Vs Werewolves Brit exploitationer. Tezz Hindi action thriller shot in Britain. Coming soon In two weeks … Stifler and co slice up American Pie: Reunion … Samurai vengeance in Takashi Miike's Hara-Kiri … In three weeks … Johnny Depp and Tim Burton's Dark Shadows … Slacker family comedy Jeff Who Lives At Home … In a month … Sacha Baron Cohen winds back the Arab spring in The Dictator … Julie Delpy pairs with Chris Rock for 2 Days In New York …
